abstract: Instead of offering bids on distressed properties, about a dozen demonstrators sang gospel-style songs against the foreclosure process. Then came the handcuffs.
snippet: Instead of offering bids on distressed properties, about a dozen demonstrators sang gospel-style songs against the foreclosure process. Then came the handcuffs.
lead_paragraph: It was just after 3 p.m. Thursday in a second-floor courtroom in Brooklyn when an auctioneer announced to a crowd of about 60 people that she would begin selling foreclosed properties.

headline.main: 9 Are Arrested at Protest at Foreclosure Auction
